html_mcq_questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language, which is the standard markup language for creating web pages.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which version of HTML introduced semantic elements?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: HTML5 introduced semantic elements like <header>, <footer>, <nav>, and <article> to better describe the content structure.

html_mcq_questions.question: What is the purpose of the DOCTYPE declaration?

options.a: To define the document type and version

html_mcq_questions.explanation: The DOCTYPE declaration tells the browser which version of HTML the page is written in.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is the root element of an HTML document?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <html> tag is the root element that contains all other HTML elements.

html_mcq_questions.question: What is the purpose of the <head> element?

options.a: To contain the main content of the page
options.b: To define metadata and links to external resources

html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <head> element contains metadata, title, and links to external resources like CSS and JavaScript files.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which character encoding is recommended for HTML5 documents?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: UTF-8 is the recommended character encoding for HTML5 documents as it supports all Unicode characters.

html_mcq_questions.question: What is the purpose of the <title> tag?

options.c: To set the browser tab title

html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <title> tag defines the title of the document, which appears in the browser's title bar or tab.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which HTML element is used to define the document's body?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <body> element contains all the contents of an HTML document, such as text, images, links, etc.

html_mcq_questions.question: What is the purpose of HTML comments?

options.b: To add notes and explanations in the code

html_mcq_questions.explanation: HTML comments are used to add notes and explanations in the code that are not displayed in the browser.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which HTML element is used to define a heading?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: HTML provides six levels of headings from <h1> (most important) to <h6> (least important).

html_mcq_questions.question: What is the purpose of the lang attribute in the <html> tag?

options.b: To define the language of the document

html_mcq_questions.explanation: The lang attribute specifies the language of the document's content, which helps with accessibility and SEO.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which HTML element is used to create a line break?
html_mcq_questions.explanation:
The
tag inserts a single line break in the text.

html_mcq_questions.question: What is the purpose of the <meta> tag?

options.b: To define metadata about the HTML document

html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <meta> tag provides metadata about the HTML document, such as character set, viewport settings, and page description.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which HTML element is used to create a horizontal rule?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <hr> tag creates a horizontal rule (line) to separate content.

html_mcq_questions.question: What is the purpose of the <base> tag?

options.a: To define the base URL for all relative URLs in the document

html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <base> tag specifies the base URL for all relative URLs in the document.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create a paragraph in HTML?
html_mcq_questions.explanation:
The

tag is used to create paragraphs in HTML.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create a hyperlink?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <a> tag is used to create hyperlinks in HTML.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create a list item?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <li> tag is used to create list items in both ordered and unordered lists.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create an unordered list?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <ul> tag is used to create an unordered (bulleted) list.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create an ordered list?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <ol> tag is used to create an ordered (numbered) list.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create a division or section?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <div> tag is used to create a division or section in an HTML document.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create a span element?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <span> tag is used to group inline elements in a document.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create a blockquote?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <blockquote> tag is used to create a block-level quotation.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create a preformatted text?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <pre> tag defines preformatted text, preserving both spaces and line breaks.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create a code element?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <code> tag is used to define a piece of computer code.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create a subscript text?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <sub> tag defines subscript text, which appears half a character below the normal line.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create a superscript text?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <sup> tag defines superscript text, which appears half a character above the normal line.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create emphasized text?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <em> tag is used to define emphasized text, which typically appears in italics.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create strong text?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <strong> tag is used to define important text, which typically appears in bold.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create a small text?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <small> tag defines smaller text, typically one size smaller than the surrounding text.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute is required for the tag?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The src attribute is required for the tag as it specifies the path to the image.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies where to open the linked document?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The target attribute specifies where to open the linked document.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the URL of the page the link goes to?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The href attribute specifies the URL of the page the link goes to.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute provides alternative text for an image?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The alt attribute provides alternative text for an image if it cannot be displayed.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked document?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The rel attribute specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked document.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which value of the target attribute opens the link in a new window?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The _blank value opens the linked document in a new window or tab.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the width of an image?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The width attribute specifies the width of an image in pixels.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the height of an image?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The height attribute specifies the height of an image in pixels.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create an image map?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <map> tag is used to define an image map, which contains clickable areas.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to define an area inside an image map?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <area> tag defines an area inside an image map.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the shape of an area in an image map?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The shape attribute specifies the shape of an area in an image map.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the coordinates of an area in an image map?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The coords attribute specifies the coordinates of an area in an image map.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to provide multiple sources for an image?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <picture> tag allows you to specify multiple sources for an image.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to specify multiple media resources for media elements?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <source> tag is used to specify multiple media resources for media elements.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the media type of the linked document?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The type attribute specifies the media type of the linked document.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create a table row?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <tr> tag defines a row in an HTML table.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create a table cell?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <td> tag defines a standard cell in an HTML table.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create a table header cell?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <th> tag defines a header cell in an HTML table.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create a table?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <table> tag defines an HTML table.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to group the header content in a table?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <thead> tag is used to group the header content in a table.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to group the body content in a table?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <tbody> tag is used to group the body content in a table.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to group the footer content in a table?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <tfoot> tag is used to group the footer content in a table.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the number of columns a cell should span?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The colspan attribute specifies the number of columns a cell should span.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the number of rows a cell should span?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The rowspan attribute specifies the number of rows a cell should span.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the space between cells in a table?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The cellspacing attribute specifies the space between cells in a table.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the space between the cell wall and the cell content?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The cellpadding attribute specifies the space between the cell wall and the cell content.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the width of a table?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The width attribute specifies the width of a table.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the alignment of the content in a cell?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The align attribute specifies the horizontal alignment of the content in a cell.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the vertical alignment of the content in a cell?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The valign attribute specifies the vertical alignment of the content in a cell.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to add a caption to a table?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <caption> tag is used to add a caption to a table.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create an HTML form?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <form> tag is used to create an HTML form for user input.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies where to send the form-data when a form is submitted?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The action attribute specifies where to send the form-data when a form is submitted.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies how to send form-data?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The method attribute specifies how to send form-data (GET or POST).

html_mcq_questions.question: Which input type creates a text field?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The text input type creates a single-line text field.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which input type creates a password field?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The password input type creates a password field where the input is masked.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which input type creates a checkbox?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The checkbox input type creates a checkbox that can be selected or deselected.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which input type creates a radio button?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The radio input type creates a radio button where only one option can be selected.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create a drop-down list?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <select> tag is used to create a drop-down list.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to define options in a drop-down list?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <option> tag is used to define options in a drop-down list.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create a text area?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <textarea> tag is used to create a multi-line text input control.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies that an input field must be filled out?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The required attribute specifies that an input field must be filled out before submitting the form.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies a short hint that describes the expected value of an input field?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The placeholder attribute specifies a short hint that describes the expected value of an input field.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the name of an input element?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The name attribute specifies the name of an input element, which is used to reference form data after submission.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to group related elements in a form?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <fieldset> tag is used to group related elements in a form.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to define a caption for a <fieldset> element?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <legend> tag defines a caption for a <fieldset> element.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to define a header for a document or section?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <header> tag represents a container for introductory content or a set of navigational links.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to define a footer for a document or section?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <footer> tag defines a footer for a document or section.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to define navigation links?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <nav> tag defines a set of navigation links.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to define an article?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <article> tag specifies independent, self-contained content.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to define a section in a document?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <section> tag defines a section in a document.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to define content aside from the page content?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <aside> tag defines content aside from the page content.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to define details that the user can open and close?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <details> tag specifies additional details that the user can open and close.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to define a visible heading for a <details> element?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <summary> tag defines a visible heading for a <details> element.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to define a dialog box or window?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <dialog> tag defines a dialog box or window.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to define a main content area?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <main> tag specifies the main content of a document.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to define a figure caption?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <figcaption> tag defines a caption for a <figure> element.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to define a figure?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <figure> tag specifies self-contained content, like illustrations, diagrams, photos, etc.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to define a time/date?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <time> tag defines a specific time or date.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to define a mark/highlighted text?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <mark> tag defines marked/highlighted text.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to define a progress bar?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <progress> tag represents the progress of a task.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to embed audio content?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <audio> tag is used to embed sound content in a document.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to embed video content?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <video> tag is used to embed video content in a document.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies that the audio/video should start playing as soon as it is ready?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The autoplay attribute specifies that the audio/video should start playing as soon as it is ready.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies that audio/video controls should be displayed?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The controls attribute specifies that audio/video controls should be displayed.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies that the audio/video should start over again when finished?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The loop attribute specifies that the audio/video should start over again when finished.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies that the audio output should be muted?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The muted attribute specifies that the audio output should be muted.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to specify multiple media resources for media elements?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <source> tag is used to specify multiple media resources for media elements.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the type of media resource?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The type attribute specifies the type of media resource.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to embed a YouTube video?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <iframe> tag is commonly used to embed YouTube videos.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to embed external applications or interactive content?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <object> tag is used to embed external applications or interactive content.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to embed external content?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <embed> tag is used to embed external content in a document.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the height of the embedded content?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The height attribute specifies the height of the embedded content.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the width of the embedded content?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The width attribute specifies the width of the embedded content.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies that the video should be displayed in fullscreen?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The allowfullscreen attribute specifies that the video should be displayed in fullscreen.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to define a container for multiple image resources?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <picture> tag gives web developers more flexibility in specifying image resources.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which entity represents the less than symbol (<)?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The < entity represents the less than symbol (<).

html_mcq_questions.question: Which entity represents the greater than symbol (>)?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The > entity represents the greater than symbol (>).

html_mcq_questions.question: Which entity represents the ampersand symbol (&)?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The & entity represents the ampersand symbol (&).

html_mcq_questions.question: Which entity represents the quotation mark (")?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The " entity represents the quotation mark (").

html_mcq_questions.question: Which entity represents the non-breaking space?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The   entity represents a non-breaking space.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which entity represents the copyright symbol (©)?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The © entity represents the copyright symbol (©).

html_mcq_questions.question: Which entity represents the registered trademark symbol (®)?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The ® entity represents the registered trademark symbol (®).

html_mcq_questions.question: Which entity represents the trademark symbol (™)?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The ™ entity represents the trademark symbol (™).

html_mcq_questions.question: Which entity represents the euro symbol (€)?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The € entity represents the euro symbol (€).

html_mcq_questions.question: Which entity represents the pound symbol (£)?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The £ entity represents the pound symbol (£).

html_mcq_questions.question: Which entity represents the yen symbol (¥)?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The ¥ entity represents the yen symbol (¥).

html_mcq_questions.question: Which entity represents the cent symbol (¢)?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The ¢ entity represents the cent symbol (¢).

html_mcq_questions.question: Which entity represents the degree symbol (°)?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The ° entity represents the degree symbol (°).

html_mcq_questions.question: Which entity represents the plus-minus symbol (±)?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The ± entity represents the plus-minus symbol (±).

html_mcq_questions.question: Which entity represents the multiplication symbol (×)?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The × entity represents the multiplication symbol (×).

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to create an inline frame?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <iframe> tag is used to create an inline frame that can embed another document within the current HTML document.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the URL of the document to embed in the iframe?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The src attribute specifies the URL of the document to embed in the iframe.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the height of the iframe?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The height attribute specifies the height of the iframe in pixels.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the width of the iframe?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The width attribute specifies the width of the iframe in pixels.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies a name for the iframe?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The name attribute specifies a name for the iframe, which can be used as a target for links.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies whether to display a border around the iframe?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The frameborder attribute specifies whether to display a border around the iframe (1 for yes, 0 for no).

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies that the iframe should be displayed in fullscreen?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The allowfullscreen attribute specifies that the iframe should be displayed in fullscreen.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the scrolling behavior of the iframe?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The scrolling attribute specifies whether to display scrollbars in the iframe (yes, no, or auto).

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the margin width of the iframe?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The marginwidth attribute specifies the margin width of the iframe in pixels.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the margin height of the iframe?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The marginheight attribute specifies the margin height of the iframe in pixels.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the sandbox restrictions for the iframe?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The sandbox attribute enables an extra set of restrictions for the content in the iframe.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the relationship between the current document and the iframe document?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The rel attribute specifies the relationship between the current document and the iframe document.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the HTML content of the page to show in the iframe?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The srcdoc attribute specifies the HTML content of the page to show in the iframe.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies that the iframe should look like it is part of the containing document?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The seamless attribute specifies that the iframe should look like it is part of the containing document.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies which referrer information to send when fetching the iframe?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The referrerpolicy attribute specifies which referrer information to send when fetching the iframe.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which tag is used to define metadata about an HTML document?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <meta> tag is used to define metadata about an HTML document.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the character encoding for the HTML document?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The charset attribute specifies the character encoding for the HTML document.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the value associated with the http-equiv or name attribute?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The content attribute specifies the value associated with the http-equiv or name attribute.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies a name for the metadata?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The name attribute specifies a name for the metadata.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute provides an HTTP header for the information/value of the content attribute?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The http-equiv attribute provides an HTTP header for the information/value of the content attribute.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which meta tag specifies the description of the web page?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <meta name='description'> tag specifies the description of the web page, which is often used by search engines.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which meta tag specifies the keywords for search engines?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <meta name='keywords'> tag specifies the keywords for search engines.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which meta tag specifies the author of the web page?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <meta name='author'> tag specifies the author of the web page.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which meta tag controls the viewport for mobile devices?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <meta name='viewport'> tag controls the viewport for mobile devices.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which meta tag specifies how often search engines should revisit the page?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <meta name='revisit-after'> tag specifies how often search engines should revisit the page.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which meta tag specifies how robots should handle the page?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <meta name='robots'> tag specifies how robots should handle the page.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which meta tag specifies a time interval for the page to refresh itself?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <meta name='refresh'> tag specifies a time interval for the page to refresh itself.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which meta tag specifies caching directives?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <meta name='cache-control'> tag specifies caching directives.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which meta tag specifies the content type and character set?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <meta http-equiv='Content-Type'> tag specifies the content type and character set.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which meta tag specifies the default style sheet language?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The <meta name='default-style'> tag specifies the default style sheet language.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies that an input field must be filled out?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The required attribute specifies that an input field must be filled out before submitting the form.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies a regular expression that the input's value must match?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The pattern attribute specifies a regular expression that the input's value must match.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the minimum value for an input element?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The min attribute specifies the minimum value for an input element.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the maximum value for an input element?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The max attribute specifies the maximum value for an input element.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the legal number intervals for an input element?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The step attribute specifies the legal number intervals for an input element.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies that the element should be disabled?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The disabled attribute specifies that the element should be disabled.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies that an input field is read-only?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The readonly attribute specifies that an input field is read-only.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the maximum number of characters allowed in an input element?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The maxlength attribute specifies the maximum number of characters allowed in an input element.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the minimum number of characters required in an input element?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The minlength attribute specifies the minimum number of characters required in an input element.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the width of an input element?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The size attribute specifies the width of an input element.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies that the element should automatically get focus when the page loads?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The autofocus attribute specifies that the element should automatically get focus when the page loads.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies that the input should be pre-selected?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The checked attribute specifies that an input element should be pre-selected.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies that the form-data should not be validated on submission?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The novalidate attribute specifies that the form-data should not be validated on submission.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the HTTP method to use when sending form-data?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The method attribute specifies the HTTP method to use when sending form-data.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies how the form-data should be encoded when submitting it to the server?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The enctype attribute specifies how the form-data should be encoded when submitting it to the server.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute provides alternative text for an image?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The alt attribute provides alternative text for an image, which is important for accessibility.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute provides additional information about an element?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The title attribute provides additional information about an element, which is important for accessibility.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the language of the element's content?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The lang attribute specifies the language of the element's content, which is important for accessibility.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the language of the element's content in XML documents?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The xml:lang attribute specifies the language of the element's content in XML documents.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies a keyboard shortcut to focus an element?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The accesskey attribute specifies a keyboard shortcut to focus an element.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies the tab order of an element?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The tabindex attribute specifies the tab order of an element.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute specifies that an element is not yet, or is no longer, relevant?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The hidden attribute specifies that an element is not yet, or is no longer, relevant.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute indicates that an element and all of its descendants are not visible or perceivable?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The aria-hidden attribute indicates that an element and all of its descendants are not visible or perceivable.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute defines a string value that labels the current element?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The aria-label attribute defines a string value that labels the current element.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute identifies the element that labels the current element?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The aria-labelledby attribute identifies the element that labels the current element.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute identifies the element that describes the current element?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The aria-describedby attribute identifies the element that describes the current element.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute indicates whether the element is exposed to an accessibility API?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The aria-hidden attribute indicates whether the element is exposed to an accessibility API.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute indicates that the element is perceivable but disabled?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The aria-disabled attribute indicates that the element is perceivable but disabled.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute indicates whether the element is expanded or collapsed?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The aria-expanded attribute indicates whether the element is expanded or collapsed.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which attribute indicates the current 'selected' state of various widgets?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The aria-selected attribute indicates the current 'selected' state of various widgets.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which API allows web applications to store data locally within the user's browser?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The Web Storage API allows web applications to store data locally within the user's browser using localStorage and sessionStorage.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which API provides a way to store significant amounts of structured data in the browser?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The IndexedDB API provides a way to store significant amounts of structured data in the browser.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which API allows web applications to access the device's camera and microphone?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The MediaStream API allows web applications to access the device's camera and microphone.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which API allows web applications to record audio and video?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The MediaRecorder API allows web applications to record audio and video.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which API enables real-time communication between browsers?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The WebRTC API enables real-time communication between browsers.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which API allows web applications to access the device's geolocation?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The Geolocation API allows web applications to access the device's geolocation.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which API allows web applications to detect device orientation and motion?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The Device Orientation API allows web applications to detect device orientation and motion.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which API allows web applications to access the device's battery status?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The Battery API allows web applications to access the device's battery status.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which API allows web applications to access the device's vibration hardware?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The Vibration API allows web applications to access the device's vibration hardware.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which API allows web applications to access the device's network information?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The Network Information API allows web applications to access the device's network information.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which API allows web applications to access the device's ambient light sensor?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The Ambient Light API allows web applications to access the device's ambient light sensor.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which API allows web applications to access the device's proximity sensor?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The Proximity API allows web applications to access the device's proximity sensor.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which API allows web applications to access the device's touch events?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The Touch Events API allows web applications to access the device's touch events.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which API allows web applications to access the device's pointer events?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The Pointer Events API allows web applications to access the device's pointer events.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which API allows web applications to access the device's fullscreen mode?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The Fullscreen API allows web applications to access the device's fullscreen mode.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which HTML5 feature allows web applications to work offline?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The Application Cache feature allows web applications to work offline by caching resources.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which HTML5 feature allows web applications to run background processes?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: Web Workers allow web applications to run background processes without blocking the main thread.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which HTML5 feature allows web applications to handle push notifications?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The Push API allows web applications to handle push notifications.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which HTML5 feature allows web applications to access the device's clipboard?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The Clipboard API allows web applications to access the device's clipboard.

html_mcq_questions.question: Which HTML5 feature allows web applications to access the device's file system?
html_mcq_questions.explanation: The File System API allows web applications to access the device's file system.

html_mcq_questions.explanation: The Battery API allows web applications to access the device's battery status.

html_mcq_questions.explanation: The Vibration API allows web applications to access the device's vibration hardware.

html_mcq_questions.explanation: The Network Information API allows web applications to access the device's network information.

html_mcq_questions.explanation: The Ambient Light API allows web applications to access the device's ambient light sensor.

html_mcq_questions.explanation: The Proximity API allows web applications to access the device's proximity sensor.

html_mcq_questions.explanation: The Touch Events API allows web applications to access the device's touch events.
